createFontRenderContext

private static void createFontRenderContext()
This method returns the FontRenderContext for the default Screen-device.

getDefaultFontRenderContext

public static java.awt.font.FontRenderContext getDefaultFontRenderContext()
Gets the FontRenderContext for the default screen-device. The FontRenderContext returned here, can be used to measure for instance the visual size of Strings that are to be painted by a component that is not realized yet. The FontRenderContext is mapped to the defaultScreenDevice of the JVM. The returned here FontRenderContext can only to be used for components that are painted onto the screen if you need a FontRenderContex for printing this will probably not work. For performance reasons we return only a reference to a static FontRenderContext-object that is created in this class. You should take care NOT to set the object returned here to null. If you do this method will have to create a new one next time it is called. So just use the returned FontRenderContext for obtaining the metrics of a font and than leave it alone.

Returns:
FontRenderContext a FontRenderContext for the default screen.

processLocation

public static java.lang.String processLocation(java.lang.String path)
Determine the file location of the current given path and relocate as appropriate. If in the database move to linkedFiles. If in LinkedFiles move to database.

Parameters:
path - the path of the file to move
Returns:
the new path of the file once moved.

unzipXMLZipFile

public static boolean unzipXMLZipFile(java.lang.String sFilePath,
                                      boolean bGiveUserXMLDialog)
                               throws java.io.IOException
Unzip the passed zip file and extract the XML.

Parameters:
sFilePath - the path to the zip file to import.
bGiveUserXMLDialog - true means give the user the XML Import dialog, else use defaults. Defaults are: import with translcusion, preserve node ids, overwrite node contents and preserve author and date in detail.
Returns:
true if completely successful.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an IO or Zip error.

createNodeAndLinkRight

public static UINode createNodeAndLinkRight(UINode uinode,
                                            int nType,
                                            int offSet,
                                            java.lang.String sText,
                                            java.lang.String sAuthor)
Create a new node of the given type, offset to the right of the given node.

Parameters:
UINode - uinode, the node to create the new node to the right of. This node must be in a view so that a call to getViewPane works.
int - nType, the type of the new node to create.
int - offSet, the offset the new node should be to the right of the current node.
String - sText, the text to put in the label of the new node.
String - sAuthor, the author of this node.
Returns:
the new uinode object, or null if something failed.

createNodeAndLink

public static UINode createNodeAndLink(int iDirection,
                                       UINode uinode,
                                       int nType,
                                       int offSet,
                                       java.lang.String sText,
                                       java.lang.String sAuthor,
                                       java.lang.String sLinkType)
Create a new node of the given type, offset in the direction specified, by the amount specified, from the given node.

Parameters:
iDirection - the direction to create the node and link (DIRECTION_RIGHT,DIRECITON_LEFT, DIRECTION_UP, DIRECTION_DOWN)
uinode - the node to create the new node to the right of. This node must be in a view so that a call to getViewPane works.
nType - the type of the new node to create.
offSet - the offset the new node should be to the right of the current node.
sText - the text to put in the label of the new node.
sAuthor - the author of this node.
sLinkType - the link type to use for the link.
Returns:
the new uinode object, or null if something failed.
